utils.js
PointA simple point.
Functions
PointIf a is a Point, creates a copy of it.
Variables
x
y
Functions
distanceReturns the distance from this point to the given Point.
RectA simple rectangle.
Functions
RectIf a is a Rect, creates a copy of it.
Variables
left
top
width
height
right
bottom
xRangeGives you a new Range for the horizontal dimension.
yRangeGives you a new Range for the vertical dimension.
Functions
intersectsReturns true if this rectangle intersects the given Rect.
intersectionReturns a new Rect with the intersection of this rectangle and the give Rect, or null if they don’t intersect.
containsReturns a boolean denoting if the Rect is contained inside of the bounding rect.
centerReturns a new Point with the center location of this rectangle.
sizeReturns a new Point with the dimensions of this rectangle.
positionReturns a new Point with the top left of this rectangle.
areaReturns the area of this rectangle.
insetMakes the rect smaller (if the arguments are positive) as if a margin is added all around the initial rect, with the margin widths (symmetric) being specified by the arguments.
offsetMoves (translates) the rect by the given vector.
equalsReturns true if this rectangle is identical to the given Rect.
unionReturns a new Rect with the union of this rectangle and the given Rect.
copyCopies the values of the given Rect into this rectangle.
cssReturns an object with the dimensions of this rectangle, suitable for passing into iQ.fn.css.
RangeA physical interval, with a min and max.
Functions
RangeCreates a Range with the given min and max
Variables
extentEquivalent to max-min
Functions
containsWhether the Range contains the given Range or value or not.
proportionMaps the given value to the range [0,1], so that it returns 0 if the value is <= the min, returns 1 if the value >= the max, and returns an interpolated “proportion” in (min, max).
scaleTakes the given value in [0,1] and maps it to the associated value on the Range.
SubscribableA mix-in for allowing objects to collect subscribers for custom events.
Functions
addSubscriberThe given callback will be called when the Subscribable fires the given event.
removeSubscriberRemoves the callback associated with refObject for the given event.
_sendToSubscribersInternal routine.
UtilsSingelton with common utility functions.
Functions
logPrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message.
errorPrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as an error.
tracePrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message, along with a full stack trace.
assertPrints a stack trace along with label (as a console message) if condition is false.
assertThrowThrows label as an exception if condition is false.
expandObjectPrints the given object to a string, including all of its properties.
expandArgumentsForLogExpands all of the given args (an array) into a single string.
isRightClickGiven a DOM mouse event, returns true if it was for the right mouse button.
isDOMElementReturns true if the given object is a DOM element.
isNumberReturns true if the argument is a valid number.
isRectReturns true if the given object ® looks like a Rect.
isRangeReturns true if the given object ® looks like a Range.
isPointReturns true if the given object (p) looks like a Point.
isPlainObjectCheck to see if an object is a plain object (created using “{}” or “new Object”).
isEmptyObjectReturns true if the given object has no members.
copyReturns a copy of the argument.
mergeMerge two arrays and return the result.
extendPass several objects in and it will combine them all into the first object and return it.
timeoutwraps setTimeout with try/catch

Point

A simple point.

Summary
Functions
PointIf a is a Point, creates a copy of it.
Variables
x
y
Functions
distanceReturns the distance from this point to the given Point.

Functions

Point

window.Point = function(a,
y)

If a is a Point, creates a copy of it.  Otherwise, expects a to be x, and creates a Point with it along with y.  If either a or y are omitted, 0 is used in their place.

Variables

x

this.x

y

this.y

Functions

distance

distance: function(point)

Returns the distance from this point to the given Point.

Rect

A simple rectangle.  Note that in addition to the left and width, it also has a right property; changing one affects the others appropriately.  Same for the vertical properties.

Summary
Functions
RectIf a is a Rect, creates a copy of it.
Variables
left
top
width
height
right
bottom
xRangeGives you a new Range for the horizontal dimension.
yRangeGives you a new Range for the vertical dimension.
Functions
intersectsReturns true if this rectangle intersects the given Rect.
intersectionReturns a new Rect with the intersection of this rectangle and the give Rect, or null if they don’t intersect.
containsReturns a boolean denoting if the Rect is contained inside of the bounding rect.
centerReturns a new Point with the center location of this rectangle.
sizeReturns a new Point with the dimensions of this rectangle.
positionReturns a new Point with the top left of this rectangle.
areaReturns the area of this rectangle.
insetMakes the rect smaller (if the arguments are positive) as if a margin is added all around the initial rect, with the margin widths (symmetric) being specified by the arguments.
offsetMoves (translates) the rect by the given vector.
equalsReturns true if this rectangle is identical to the given Rect.
unionReturns a new Rect with the union of this rectangle and the given Rect.
copyCopies the values of the given Rect into this rectangle.
cssReturns an object with the dimensions of this rectangle, suitable for passing into iQ.fn.css.

Functions

Rect

window.Rect = function(a,
top,
width,
height)

If a is a Rect, creates a copy of it.  Otherwise, expects a to be left, and creates a Rect with it along with top, width, and height.

Variables

left

this.left

top

this.top

width

this.width

height

this.height

right

bottom

xRange

Gives you a new Range for the horizontal dimension.

yRange

Gives you a new Range for the vertical dimension.

Functions

intersects

intersects: function(rect)

Returns true if this rectangle intersects the given Rect.

intersection

intersection: function(rect)

Returns a new Rect with the intersection of this rectangle and the give Rect, or null if they don’t intersect.

contains

contains: function(rect)

Returns a boolean denoting if the Rect is contained inside of the bounding rect.

Paramaters

  • A Rect

center

center: function()

Returns a new Point with the center location of this rectangle.

size

size: function()

Returns a new Point with the dimensions of this rectangle.

position

position: function()

Returns a new Point with the top left of this rectangle.

area

area: function()

Returns the area of this rectangle.

inset

inset: function(a,
b)

Makes the rect smaller (if the arguments are positive) as if a margin is added all around the initial rect, with the margin widths (symmetric) being specified by the arguments.

Paramaters

  • A Point or two arguments: x and y

offset

offset: function(a,
b)

Moves (translates) the rect by the given vector.

Paramaters

  • A Point or two arguments: x and y

equals

equals: function(rect)

Returns true if this rectangle is identical to the given Rect.

union

union: function(a)

Returns a new Rect with the union of this rectangle and the given Rect.

copy

copy: function(a)

Copies the values of the given Rect into this rectangle.

css

css: function()

Returns an object with the dimensions of this rectangle, suitable for passing into iQ.fn.css.  You could of course just pass the rectangle straight in, but this is cleaner.

Range

A physical interval, with a min and max.

Summary
Functions
RangeCreates a Range with the given min and max
Variables
extentEquivalent to max-min
Functions
containsWhether the Range contains the given Range or value or not.
proportionMaps the given value to the range [0,1], so that it returns 0 if the value is <= the min, returns 1 if the value >= the max, and returns an interpolated “proportion” in (min, max).
scaleTakes the given value in [0,1] and maps it to the associated value on the Range.

Functions

Range

window.Range = function(min,
max)

Creates a Range with the given min and max

Variables

extent

Equivalent to max-min

Functions

contains

contains: function(value)

Whether the Range contains the given Range or value or not.

Paramaters

  • a number or Range

proportion

proportion: function(value,
smooth)

Maps the given value to the range [0,1], so that it returns 0 if the value is <= the min, returns 1 if the value >= the max, and returns an interpolated “proportion” in (min, max).

Paramaters

  • a number
  • (bool) smooth?  If true, a smooth tanh-based function will be used instead of the linear.

scale

scale: function(value)

Takes the given value in [0,1] and maps it to the associated value on the Range.

Paramaters

  • a number in [0,1]

Subscribable

A mix-in for allowing objects to collect subscribers for custom events.

Summary
Functions
addSubscriberThe given callback will be called when the Subscribable fires the given event.
removeSubscriberRemoves the callback associated with refObject for the given event.
_sendToSubscribersInternal routine.

Functions

addSubscriber

addSubscriber: function(refObject,
eventName,
callback)

The given callback will be called when the Subscribable fires the given event.  The refObject is used to facilitate removal if necessary.

removeSubscriber

removeSubscriber: function(refObject,
eventName)

Removes the callback associated with refObject for the given event.

_sendToSubscribers

_sendToSubscribers: function(eventName,
eventInfo)

Internal routine.  Used by the Subscribable to fire events.

Utils

Singelton with common utility functions.

Summary
Functions
logPrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message.
errorPrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as an error.
tracePrints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message, along with a full stack trace.
assertPrints a stack trace along with label (as a console message) if condition is false.
assertThrowThrows label as an exception if condition is false.
expandObjectPrints the given object to a string, including all of its properties.
expandArgumentsForLogExpands all of the given args (an array) into a single string.
isRightClickGiven a DOM mouse event, returns true if it was for the right mouse button.
isDOMElementReturns true if the given object is a DOM element.
isNumberReturns true if the argument is a valid number.
isRectReturns true if the given object ® looks like a Rect.
isRangeReturns true if the given object ® looks like a Range.
isPointReturns true if the given object (p) looks like a Point.
isPlainObjectCheck to see if an object is a plain object (created using “{}” or “new Object”).
isEmptyObjectReturns true if the given object has no members.
copyReturns a copy of the argument.
mergeMerge two arrays and return the result.
extendPass several objects in and it will combine them all into the first object and return it.
timeoutwraps setTimeout with try/catch

Functions

log

log: function()

Prints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message.  Pass as many arguments as you want, it’ll print them all.

error

error: function()

Prints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as an error.  Pass as many arguments as you want, it’ll print them all.  TODO: Does this still work?

trace

trace: function()

Prints the given arguments to the JavaScript error console as a message, along with a full stack trace.  Pass as many arguments as you want, it’ll print them all.

assert

assert: function Utils_assert(label,
condition)

Prints a stack trace along with label (as a console message) if condition is false.

assertThrow

assertThrow: function(label,
condition)

Throws label as an exception if condition is false.

expandObject

expandObject: function(obj)

Prints the given object to a string, including all of its properties.

expandArgumentsForLog

expandArgumentsForLog: function(args)

Expands all of the given args (an array) into a single string.

isRightClick

isRightClick: function(event)

Given a DOM mouse event, returns true if it was for the right mouse button.

isDOMElement

isDOMElement: function(object)

Returns true if the given object is a DOM element.

isNumber

isNumber: function(n)

Returns true if the argument is a valid number.

isRect

isRect: function(r)

Returns true if the given object ® looks like a Rect.

isRange

isRange: function(r)

Returns true if the given object ® looks like a Range.

isPoint

isPoint: function(p)

Returns true if the given object (p) looks like a Point.

isPlainObject

isPlainObject: function(obj)

Check to see if an object is a plain object (created using “{}” or “new Object”).

isEmptyObject

isEmptyObject: function(obj)

Returns true if the given object has no members.

copy

copy: function(value)

Returns a copy of the argument.  Note that this is a shallow copy; if the argument has properties that are themselves objects, those properties will be copied by reference.

merge

merge: function(first,
second)

Merge two arrays and return the result.

extend

extend: function()

Pass several objects in and it will combine them all into the first object and return it.

timeout

timeout: function(func,
delay)

wraps setTimeout with try/catch

Note to our beloved reviewers: we are keeping this trivial wrapper in case we make Utils a JSM.
